text: I have these two sweet potatoes here
there were about one and a half pounds
and I baked them for my amazing dessert
that I'm gonna share with you today it's
a sweet potato cheesecake square not
only is it a great make-ahead dessert
for Thanksgiving but it's also easier
because you're using a pressing crust
instead of your classic like peppers a
cross door you know butter pastry crust
so start off by making your crust we'll
start off by making a few potatoes and
letting them cool then you make your
graham cracker crust
I have 18 graham crackers this it's kind
of a big graham cracker crust recipe
because I'm going to be filling a 9 by
13 inch baking pan instead of your usual
pie plate grind them up until they're
fine cuz you filled about two and a
quarter cups add a half a cup of melted
butter unsalted third of a cup of sugar
and a little bit of salt about a quarter
of a teaspoon of coarse salt pulse
everything until it's uniformly
moistened with the butter and then you
can just press it into your pan is that
9 by 13 inch baking pan and you just
press your crust mixture into the pan
nice and evenly so I baked my potatoes
at 375 I still have my oven at 375 for
the crust press your prom mixture evenly
into the 9 by 13 inch pan I like to use
the bottom of a 1 cup dry measure to
really get it nice and even and firm you
can also use the bottom of a glass I
mean you can use your hands but I think
I feel like using something more solid
works really well you want to bake this
just a little bit so the sugar melts and
sort of starts holding everything
together and forming a crust about 12
minutes it'll get a little bit golden
brown so now to make the filling once
your quest comes out of the oven let it
cool the potatoes have cooled enough to
touch and you can puree them you can
mash them ahead with a fork but
everything's going to get pureed
together so I'm just going to pulse it
briefly in my food processor you don't
need the skin for this recipe but I
highly recommend that you eat
because it's really yummy and really
good for you mmm
sweet potatoes are the best right I love
them pulse it just to break it down you
could do this with a fork too in a bowl
if you wanted to and then add the
remaining cheese cake making ingredients
one and a half cups of ricotta cheese
ricotta adds a nice lightness to this
cheesecake it's a little bit less dense
than like an all sour cream one which is
a little more common half a cup of Greek
yogurt you're getting a lot of really
nice creaminess with the Greek yogurt a
little bit of Tang which is really nice
and not quite as much fat as sour cream
if that was something you were concerned
about four large eggs a quarter of a
teaspoon of salt coarse salt a quarter
of a cup of melted butter cooled and
melted melted and cold anyway and then
two-thirds of a cup of sugar it's a big
filling because it's a big dessert and
the great thing about it is it's big but
you cut it into small squares so it
serves a lot of people too
blend everything together really well
some of my sweet potato seems to be
caught on the side of the food processor
Bowl so give it a scrape
pour the filling into the baked crust
and have your oven now at 325 degrees
cheesecakes need to bake at a lower
temperature than crusts do so you want
to reduce your temperature but the great
thing about this recipe is it does not
need a water bath or anything fancy like
that so it's really really simple to
make I feel like if you added just a
little bit less sugar to this and baked
it without the crust it could be some
kind of amazing savory breakfast always
using my maghen you wanted to add a
little bit of spice to this which it
doesn't have you could add a little bit
of cinnamon nutmeg allspice a grating of
lemon zest orange zest would also be
really nice but it's very simple and
delicious all on its own
bake this at 325 until it's just set in
the center it will take about 30 to 35
minutes when your cheesecake comes out
of the oven let it cool for about 30
minutes and then refrigerate it up to
overnight maybe even a little bit longer
you could do it two days ahead if you
wanted to and then you can serve it it's
a beautiful bright orange color it's
like a pumpkin pie but so much easier
than a pumpkin pie if you askme
cut into squares you might want to wipe
off your knife between cuts if you want
to you want to get a nice clean cut or
even use like a hot knife but it's not
necessary you can do it this way first
piece is a little bit difficult to get
out there we go a nice big piece for me
this is even more delicious I think than

a little bit of soft whipped cream on

everybody's going to agree that it's
